yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.pas: Displays a health bar above passive mobs
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.hos: Displays a health bar above hostile mobs
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.ang: Displays a health bar above angered mobs. This is different from 'Hostile Mobs,' since a passive mob (eg: iron golem, enderman) are not considered a hostile mob, but can still attack the player if provoked.
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.pla: Displays a health bar above other players
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.sel: Displays a health bar above yourself in third person and in the inventory menu
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.bla:
Toggles Blacklist/Whitelist mode for the below list 

 If you choose Blacklist, then the list below will prevent displaying health bars over the entered entity types. 

 If you choose Whitelist, then Health bars will only display over the entity types listed in the list. Leave the list empty to disable.
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.lis: Blacklist/whitelists the entity types from having their health rendered.
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.whi: Health bars will only display over the entity types listed in this list. Leave this list empty to disable.
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.aft: Health will display only after the entity has been attacked.
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.tim: Health indicator will disappear after the set number of seconds.
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.dam: Health will display only if the entity's health is lower than its max health. May not work in cases where entities have absorption effect.
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.max:
The maximum amount of health, as a percentage of the total, that it needs to be for the indicator to display. 

For example, if you set it to 40%, then entities with health above 40% will not display an indicator. Set this to 100% to display for all entities.
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.loo: Health will only render if the entity is being looked at.
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.rea: How far can the entity be for the 'targeted' option. The default value (3 blocks) is equal to the attack reach for survival minecraft.
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.wit: Entities beyond this distance will not render health. Note: This is different from the 'range' option; the range option modifies the targeted distance while this option limits all visibility beyond a certain distance
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.ove: Overrides the above options to always display health of Players, even if they have not been attacked, they are full health or they are not on crosshair

Overrides above criteria and always renders health for the below entity types. 
 
 Currently only the playerentity type is supported here.
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.ind: Whether to render a floating hearts display or a number display. Settings this to 'dynamic' will render hearts for entities with less than 100 health, and numbers for entities with more than 100 health.
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.use: Some resource packs use a custom heart icon, which can break this mod. Enabling this setting will override the custom icon.
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.sho: Some status effects and conditions (poisoned, withered, hardcore, frozen) changes the texture of the hearts. Enabling this option will change the texture of the health indicator's heart's as well.
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.ren: Whether there should be a shadow behind the display text
Whether there should be a colored background behind the number display
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.dec: The number of decimal places that should appear in the number display.
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.num: The background color for the number display
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.per:
Shows health as a percentage instead of raw values. Enabling this would mean that all mobs would show the same base-health (configurable below) and their actual health would be shown out of that. 

For example, an iron golem might have 40 out of 50 hearts, but the indicator will show 8 out of 10 hearts. 

The number-type indicator will not follow this mechanic, and simply show a % value: e.g. 80%
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.max: The base value (in hp, not hearts! 1 heart = 2hp) for the percentage based health.
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.dis: The distance between the top of the Entity and the health display. Negative offset values can make the health display render below or in the middle of the entity. Extreme offset values can make the health display render out of view.
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.off: The offset that the keybind (default up-arrow and down-arrow) will change per click.
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.for:
Normally, the health display renders at a higher offset for Players and Entities with a visible name-tag. 
 
 However, some servers implement a custom name-tag which the mod does not recognize and account for. This option will forcibly raise offset for *all* players to fix the problem.
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.mes: Whether mod messages (Indicator Enabled/Disabled, Heart Offset, etc) will be sent in chat, actionbar or not be sent at all
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.col: Whether the Indicator Enabled/Disabled messages should be colored (Green and Red respectively)
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.ena: Enables the /healthindicators command and its subcommands
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.hea: Hearts will get pushed downwards if there is a solid block at their normal rendering position.
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.ena: These indicators will display an arrow around your crosshair to show the direction of incoming damage, helping you quickly identify threats.
yacl3.config.healthindicators:config.dam: Size of the Damage Direction Indicators.
Color of the Damage Direction Indicators.
The time it takes for the Damage Direction Indicators to go away in seconds.
Whether the Damage Direction Indicators should fade out.
The length of the fade-out animation in seconds. This number **must** be less than the 'Time to disappear'
